Question_title: Sign up for SigOpt for free!
Question_body: Interested in trying the SigOpt platform? Sign up for your free account here, and get optimizing today!
This category is here for you to post any general questions or topics you’d like to discuss with the community. Please observe community rules, and enjoy!
I found an old example on DQN on the github page. But it was using TF v1 and the old sigopt. It would have been nice to get a new tutorial replacing it.

Question_title: "Early Stop" feature and API call for terminating running experiment
Question_body:
Hi,

I was wondering if there is an “early stop” feature for the SigOpt optimization: something that would stop the Experiment once a user provided value for a given metric is satisfied (ie. if our metric is ‘time’, then the experiment would stop before it runs out of budget, as soon as any of it’s run achieves a ‘time’ metric below a defined value.)
I looked at the API Reference documentation and didn’t find any similar feature so I started working on a separate python script that sends a query to the API and pulls the best runs from the given experiment (via the use of sigopt.get_experiment(experiment_id).get_best_runs() method).
From there it is easy to write custom logic based on the pulled data, however I cannot find an elegant way to close the Experiment (if I find the best run data to be good enough). The only way I was able to pull it off is via the use of sigopt.archive_experiment([experiment ID]). This will cause an error in the currently running optimization job, as the sigopt won’t be able to log any run data to an archived experiment (that’s ok - this is the behaviour I’m looking for), however it also means that the Experiment is moved to the archived section (not great, would prefer to keep it in the main view). If there was an API call to just close the given experiment (without moving it to archive) it would be great!
Is there any missing API call that I missed that would enable such functionality?

Thanks!
In the “trials vs best value” visualization I see a lot of points with the same value. Does this mean that SigOpt is not finding any improvement for those runs?

I am checking out the sigopt.xgboost API. How do I perform cross-validation with it?

I think I see how to do it using sigopt.create_experiment, because that expects the training to happen external of the API call, and I can use a cross-validation technique that I am familiar with (e.g. sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_score). However sigopt.create_experiment also requires me to do more work setting up parameter search ranges compare to sigopt.xgboost.
How do I know that the parameters picked by SigOpt are the best ones?

Question_title: What Compute Infrastructure do I have to use?
Question_body: Where can you choose the device you’d like to execute a SigOpt run or optimization on? Is there a default device?

Question_title: Suppress output during SigOpt runs optimization
Question_body:
Right now, when I run with

while not experiment.is_finished():
    with experiment.create_run() as run:

I get Run started and Run finished calls. How can I suppress these if I don’t want to see this output?

Question_title: Can I use SigOpt together with any cloud provider?
Question_body:
The short answer it Yes!

The SigOpt backend is communicating with your environment using a lightweight API. So as long as you have access to the internet you can use SigOpt for your modeling project.

Similarly you can use SigOpt together with any infrastructure available (your laptop, company wide cluster etc.) as long as you can connect to the internet.

Neural Architecture Search is certainly a challenge that faces the modeling and optimization community today. What are some examples of efficient or effective NAS experiments that you’ve come across lately?

Question_title: Has SigOpt been used for NLP tasks?
Question_body: Yes, SigOpt can and has been applied to a variety of applications, NLP included. Check out this blog post to see how we tackled the task of question answering by tuning the architecture of BERT.
